intro: Chytranthus bracteosus, commonly known as the bracteate chytranthus, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Capparaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in coastal areas. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and it produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
